alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 4:41PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette County through 530 PM EDT... At 441 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Luraville, or near Mayo, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayo, Buckville, Day, Alton, Chancey and Mayo Junction. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
